|url=http://www.dw.com/en/donald-trumps-german-roots/a-19015570 |website=[[Deutsche Welle]] |language=en |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119182128/http://www.dw.com/en/donald-trumps-german-roots/a-19015570 |archivedate=November 19, 2016 }} and Scottish ancestry{{cite web |last1=Brocklehurst |first1=Steven |title=Donald Trump's mother: From a Scottish island to New York's elite |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-38648877 |website=BBC News |accessdate=April 25, 2017 |location=Scotland |language=English |date=January 19, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330091701/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-38648877 |archivedate=March 30, 2017 }} and her mother has Czech and Austrian ancestry.[http://www.cosmopolitan.com/politics/a56426/ivana-trump-donald-trump-first-wife/ Prachi Gupta, "6 Things You Need to Know About Donald Trump's First Wife, Ivana"]. ''[[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]]''. March 16, 2017. Retrieved October 1, 2017. For most of her life, she has been nicknamed "Ivanka," a [[diminutive]] form of Ivana.{{cite web |title=Ivanka Trump: Model, Businesswoman, Daughter to Republican Nominee |url=http://www.voanews.com/a/ivanka-trump-businesswoman-model-daughter-donald-trump/3429488.html |accessdate=February 5, 2017 |website=[[Voice of America|Voice of America News]] |date=July 21, 2016 |language=en |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170206184611/http://www.voanews.com/a/ivanka-trump-businesswoman-model-daughter-donald-trump/3429488.html |archivedate=February 6, 2017 }} Trump's parents divorced in 1992 when she was ten years old.{{cite news|title=Ivana Trump to write memoir about raising US president's children |url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2017/mar/16/ivana-trump-write-memoir-about-raising-us-presidents-donald-children|work=The Guardian|agency=Associated Press|date=March 16, 2017 |language=en}} She has two brothers, [[Donald Trump Jr.|Donald Jr.]] and [[Eric Trump|Eric]], a half-sister, [[Tiffany Trump|Tiffany]], and a half-brother, [[Family of Donald Trump#Barron Trump|Barron]]. Trump attended the [[Chapin School]] in Manhattan until she was 15, when she transferred to [[Choate Rosemary Hall]] in [[Wallingford, Connecticut]]. She characterized Choate's "boarding-school life" as being like a "prison", while her "friends in New York were having fun".{{cite web |url=http://www.marieclaire.com/career-advice/tips/a105/ivanka-trump/ |title=Trump Power |first=George |last=Gurley |website=[[Marie Claire]] |date=January 29, 2007 |accessdate=February 19, 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141216140821/http://www.marieclaire.com/career-advice/tips/a105/ivanka-trump/ |archivedate=December 16, 2014 }} After graduating from Choate,{{cite web |url=http://nymag.com/nymetro/news/people/features/10610/index4.html |title=Did Their Father Really Know Best? |first=Jonathan |last=Van Meter |website=[[New York (magazine)|New York]] |date=December 13, 2004 |accessdate=November 7, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141107231501/http://nymag.com/nymetro/news/people/features/10610/index4.html |archivedate=November 7, 2014 }} she attended [[Georgetown University]] for two years, then transferred to the [[Wharton School]] at the [[University of Pennsylvania]], from which she graduated ''[[cum laude#Types|cum laude]]'' with a bachelor's degree in economics in 2004.{{cite web |last=Seligson |first=Hannah |url=http://highline.huffingtonpost.com/articles/en/is-ivanka-for-real/ |title=Is Ivanka for real? |website=[[The Huffington Post]] |date=September 7, 2016|access-date=May 18, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170531125808/http://highline.huffingtonpost.com/articles/en/is-ivanka-for-real/ |archivedate=May 31, 2017 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.ivankatrump.com/about-ivanka |title=About Ivanka |date=November 14, 2012 |accessdate=June 12, 2017 |publisher=Ivanka Trump |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121114234209/http://www.ivankatrump.com/about-ivanka |archivedate=November 14, 2012}} For level of honor see last paragraph of website bio. Her father had also transferred to Wharton after two years at another institution.{{cite news |first=Matt |last=Viser |title=Even in college, Donald Trump was brash |newspaper=[[Boston Globe]] |url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/news/nation/2015/08/28/donald-trump-was-bombastic-even-wharton-business-school/3FO0j1uS5X6S8156yH3YhL/story.html |date=August 28, 2015 |access-date=May 28, 2018}} ==Career== ===Business=== Trump briefly worked for [[Forest City Enterprises]]. In 2005, she joined the family business as Executive Vice-President of Development & Acquisitions at [[The Trump Organization]].{{cite web |url=http://biz.yahoo.com/special/usrich06_article2.html|title=The Forbes 400 Richest Americans 2006: The Real Apprentices|last=Fitch|first=Stephane|date=2006|website=Forbes|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080113043430/http://biz.yahoo.com/special/usrich06_article2.html|archivedate=January 13, 2008}} In 2007, she formed a partnership with Dynamic Diamond Corp., the company of diamond vendor [[Moshe Lax]], to create Ivanka Trump Fine Jewelry, a line of diamond and gold jewelry, sold at her first flagship retail store in [[Manhattan]].{{cite web|url=http://instoremag.com/indesign/if-i-owned/4002-if-i-owned-ivanka-trump.html|title=If I Owned a jewelry store|first=Ivanka|last=Trump|publisher=InStoreMag.com|date=January 29, 2010|accessdate=October 27, 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150918083842/http://instoremag.com/indesign/if-i-owned/4002-if-i-owned-ivanka-trump.html|archivedate=September 18, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ivankatrump.com/about/|title=About|date=September 23, 2014|publisher=IvankaTrump.com|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609121336/http://www.ivankatrump.com/about/|archivedate=June 9, 2016}} In November 2011, her retail flagship moved from Madison Avenue to 109 Mercer Street, a larger space in the fashionable Soho district.{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/anthonydemarco/2011/07/12/luxury-jewelry-brands-ivanka-trump-and-aaron-basha-relocate-n-y-boutiques/|last=DeMarco|first=Anthony|title=Luxury Jewelry Brands Ivanka Trump and Aaron Basha Relocate N.Y. Boutiques|website=Forbes|date=July 12, 2011|accessdate=October 21, 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161022025904/http://www.forbes.com/sites/anthonydemarco/2011/07/12/luxury-jewelry-brands-ivanka-trump-and-aaron-basha-relocate-n-y-boutiques/|archivedate=October 22, 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://nymag.com/thecut/2011/11/inside-ivanka-trumps-new-boutique.html|last=Murrow|first=Lauren|title=Now Open: Inside Ivanka Trump's New Diamond-Packed Boutique|website=New York|date=November 29, 2011|accessdate=October 21, 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161022085420/http://nymag.com/thecut/2011/11/inside-ivanka-trumps-new-boutique.html|archivedate=October 22, 2016}} In December 2012, members of [[100 Women in Hedge Funds]] elected Ivanka Trump to their board.Delevingne, Lawrence, [https://www.hedgefundintelligence.com/Article/3128519/Say-what-Ivanka-Trump-joins-100-Women-in-Hedge-Funds-board.html?ArticleId=3128519 "Say what? Ivanka Trump joins 100 Women in Hedge Funds board"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330175410/https://www.hedgefundintelligence.com/Article/3128519/Say-what-Ivanka-Trump-joins-100-Women-in-Hedge-Funds-board.html?ArticleId=3128519|date=March 30, 2017}} ''hedgefundintelligence.com'', December 7, 2012. On October 2, 2015, it was reported that "Ivanka Trump's flagship store on Mercer Street appear[s] to be closed" and, noting that the shop had been "stripped clean".{{cite web|url=http://ny.racked.com/2015/10/2/9440019/ivanka-trump-soho-store-closed|last=Gurfein|first=Laura|title=Discontinued: Ivanka Trump's Soho Flagship Has Quietly Shuttered|publisher=[[Racked.com]]|location=New York|date=October 2, 2015|accessdate=October 21, 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161022085124/http://ny.racked.com/2015/10/2/9440019/ivanka-trump-soho-store-closed|archivedate=October 22, 2016}} In October 2016, the only dedicated retail shop and flagship boutique for Ivanka Trump Fine Jewelry is located at [[Trump Tower]] in [[Manhattan]], [[New York City]], with her brand also being available at [[Hudson's Bay (retailer)|Hudson's Bay]] and fine-jewelry stores throughout the U.S. and Canada, as well as in Bahrain, Kuwait, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and the United Arab Emirates.{{cite web|url=http://www.ivankatrumpfinejewelry.com/international/|title=Store Locator: International Locations|publisher=ivankatrumpfinejewelry.com|accessdate=October 21, 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161022031501/http://www.ivankatrumpfinejewelry.com/international/|archivedate=October 22, 2016}} She also has her own line of Ivanka Trump fashion items, including clothes, handbags, shoes, and accessories, which is available in major U.S. and Canadian department stores, including, [[Macy's]] and [[Hudson's Bay (retailer)|Hudson's Bay]].{{cite news|title=Who is Ivanka Trump? Fashion designer, trusted adviser|work=[[USA Today]]|date=July 21, 2016|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/onpolitics/2016/07/21/who-is-ivanka-trump-fashion-designer-trusted-adviser/87406736/|accessdate=July 22, 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160722115332/http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/onpolitics/2016/07/21/who-is-ivanka-trump-fashion-designer-trusted-adviser/87406736/|archivedate=July 22, 2016}} Her brand was criticized for allegedly copying designs by other designers,{{cite news|url=http://gawker.com/5870437/ivanka-trump-accused-of-stealing-designs-from-actual-fashion-designer|title=Ivanka Trump Accused of Stealing Designs from Actual Fashion Designer|first=Brian|last=Moylan|publisher=Gawker|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606104831/http://gawker.com/5870437/ivanka-trump-accused-of-stealing-designs-from-actual-fashion-designer|date=December 22, 2011|archivedate=June 6, 2016}}{{cite news|url=http://mashable.com/2016/03/21/ivanka-trump-aquazzura-shoe-copy/|title=Ivanka Trump accused of copying popular shoe design|first=David|last=Yi|date=March 22, 2016|work=Mashable|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160523104702/http://mashable.com/2016/03/21/ivanka-trump-aquazzura-shoe-copy/|archivedate=May 23, 2016}} and by [[PETA]] and other [[animal rights]] activists for using fur from rabbits.{{cite web|url=http://www.pubpolitica.com/2016/02/17/peta-tries-to-pull-the-rabbit-out-of-ivanka-trumps-hat/|title=PETA tries to pull the rabbit out of Ivanka Trump's hat|date=February 17, 2016|publisher=PubPolitica|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160630095805/http://www.pubpolitica.com/2016/02/17/peta-tries-to-pull-the-rabbit-out-of-ivanka-trumps-hat/|archivedate=June 30, 2016}}{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/02/17/politics/ivanka-trump-peta-rabbit-fur/index.html|title=PETA tries to pull the rabbit out of Ivanka Trump's hat|first=Gregory|last=Krieg|work=CNN|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160704210954/http://www.cnn.com/2016/02/17/politics/ivanka-trump-peta-rabbit-fur/index.html|archivedate=July 4, 2016}} In 2016, the [[U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission]] recalled "Ivanka Trump"-branded scarves because they did not meet federal flammability standards.{{cite web|url=https://blogs.wsj.com/washwire/2016/04/06/safety-agency-recalls-ivanka-trump-brand-scarves-over-burn-risk/|title=Safety Agency Recalls Ivanka Trump-Brand Scarves Over 'Burn Risk'|first=Byron|last=Tau|website=The Wall Street Journal|date=April 6, 2014| access-date= September 29, 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160928032817/http://blogs.wsj.com/washwire/2016/04/06/safety-agency-recalls-ivanka-trump-brand-scarves-over-burn-risk/|archivedate=September 28, 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/ivanka-trump-scarves-recalled-burn-risk/story?id=38206629|title=Ivanka Trump Scarves Recalled Over 'Burn Risk'|date=April 6, 2016|first=Erin|last=Dooley|publisher=ABC News|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160604092015/http://abcnews.go.com/US/ivanka-trump-scarves-recalled-burn-risk/story?id=38206629|archivedate=June 4, 2016}} A 2016 analysis found that most of the fashion line was produced outside the U.S.{{cite web|last=Phelps|first=Jordyn|title=Trump Decries Outsourcing but Much of Family Brand Is Made Abroad|publisher=ABC News|date=March 9, 2016|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/donald-trump-decries-outsourcing-family-brand-manufactured-abroad/story?id=37502012|accessdate=July 22, 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160722080642/http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/donald-trump-decries-outsourcing-family-brand-manufactured-abroad/story?id=37502012|archivedate=July 22, 2016}} Ivanka Trump-brand shoes have been supplied by Chengdu Kameido Shoes in [[Sichuan]] and Hangzhou HS Fashion (via G-III Apparel Group) in [[Zhejiang]].{{cite news|url=https://www.politico.com/story/2018/07/07/china-trade-war-ivanka-trump-business-shoes-701668|publisher=''[[Politico]]''|title=As trade war rages, the shoe biz goes on for Ivanka Trump and her Chinese suppliers|first=Kinling|last=Lo|date=July 7, 2018}} In February 2017, department store chains [[Neiman Marcus]] and [[Nordstrom]] dropped Trump's fashion line, citing "poor performance."O'Hara, Mary Emily, [http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/nordstrom-drops-ivanka-trump-line-citing-poor-performance-n716361 "Nordstrom Drops Ivanka Trump Line, Citing Poor 'Performance'"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170221191355/http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/nordstrom-drops-ivanka-trump-line-citing-poor-performance-n716361|date=February 21, 2017}}, ''NBC News'', February 3, 2017. Retrieved February 3, 2017. On February 9, 2017, Presidential Advisor [[Kellyanne Conway]] controversially encouraged [[Fox News]] viewers to purchase Trump's retail products.{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/09/514317345/kellyanne-conway-tells-americans-to-buy-ivanka-trumps-products|title=Kellyanne Conway Tells Americans To Buy Ivanka Trump's Products|publisher=|accessdate=March 5, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170303111408/http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/09/514317345/kellyanne-conway-tells-americans-to-buy-ivanka-trumps-products|archivedate=March 3, 2017}} In June 2017, three people with the organization called China Labor Watch were arrested by Chinese authorities while investigating Huajian International, which makes shoes for several American brands, including the Ivanka Trump brand. The Trump Administration has called for their release.[https://www.nytimes.com/2017/06/06/business/china-labor-activists-ivanka-trump-shoes.html "U.S. Presses China to Free Activists Scrutinizing Ivanka Trump Shoe Factory"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170608041800/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/06/06/business/china-labor-activists-ivanka-trump-shoes.html|date=June 8, 2017}}, ''New York Times'', June 6, 2017[http://time.com/4808484/china-ivanka-trump-shoe-supplier "China Defends Arrest of Men Investigating Ivanka Trump's Shoe Supplier"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170610192805/http://time.com/4808484/china-ivanka-trump-shoe-supplier/|date=June 10, 2017}}, ''TIME'', June 6, 2017 On July 24, 2018, Ivanka Trump announced that she decided to shut down her company after deciding to pursue a career in [[public policy]] instead of returning to her fashion company.{{cite news|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/business/consumer/ivanka-trump-closing-down-her-fashion-business-citing-conflict-white-n894141|title=Ivanka Trump is closing down her fashion business to focus on her White House role|last=Popken|first=Ben|date=July 24, 2018|work=[[NBC News]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180731062848/https://www.nbcnews.com/business/consumer/ivanka-trump-closing-down-her-fashion-business-citing-conflict-white-n894141|archive-date=July 31, 2018|deadurl=no}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-ivanka/ivanka-trump-closes-fashion-line-to-focus-on-helping-her-father-idUSKBN1KE2JN|title=Ivanka Trump closes fashion line to focus on helping her father|last=Reuters Staff|first=|date=July 25, 2018|work=[[Reuters]]|access-date=August 4, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180804053855/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-ivanka/ivanka-trump-closes-fashion-line-to-focus-on-helping-her-father-idUSKBN1KE2JN|archive-date=August 4, 2018|dead-url=no}} ===Modeling=== [[File:Ivankatrump.jpg|thumb|upright=0.5|Trump in July 2007]] When Trump was attending boarding school as a teenager, she got into modeling "on weekends and holidays and absolutely not during the school year," according to her mother, [[Ivana Trump]].{{cite web |last=Steinhauer |first=Jennifer |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1997/08/17/style/her-cheekbones-high-or-her-name-trump.html |title=Her Cheekbones (High) Or Her Name (Trump)? |website=[[The New York Times]] |date=August 17, 1997|access-date= June 28, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170613083555/http://www.nytimes.com/1997/08/17/style/her-cheekbones-high-or-her-name-trump.html |archivedate=June 13, 2017 }} She was featured in print advertisements for [[Tommy Hilfiger (company)|Tommy Hilfiger]] and Sasson Jeans{{cite web |url=http://www.ebay.com/itm/IVANKA-TRUMP-1998-MAGAZINE-PRINT-AD-FOR-SASSOON-JEANS-FASHION-PRINT-AD-/232324838341 |title=Sasson print ad |date=June 1, 1997|access-date=June 28, 2017}} "Sasson" is not a typo, no connection to Vidal Sassoon brand.{{cite web |last=Shiver Jr. |first=Jube |url=http://articles.latimes.com/1986-10-11/business/fi-2854_1_sasson-jeans |title=With Fad Faded, Sasson Jeans Seeks Bankruptcy Shield |website=[[The Los Angeles Times]] |date=October 11, 1986|access-date= June 28, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111202423/http://articles.latimes.com/1986-10-11/business/fi-2854_1_sasson-jeans |archivedate=January 11, 2012 }} and walked fashion runways for [[Gianni Versace S.p.A.|Versace]], [[Marc Bouwer]] and [[Thierry Mugler]]. In May 1997, she was featured on the cover of ''[[Seventeen (American magazine)|Seventeen]]'' which ran a story on "celeb moms & daughters". Trump joined the Trump Organization in an executive position. Soon after that, she started her jewelry, shoe, and apparel lines, and she appeared in advertisements promoting the Trump Organization and her products. She was also featured in women's and special interest publications in "soft-hitting" profiles focusing on her "looks, lifestyles, and product lines", and featuring her on the cover of the same issue, like ''[[Harper's Bazaar]]'', ''[[Forbes Life]]'', ''[[Golf Magazine]]'', ''[[Town & Country (magazine)|Town & Country]]'', and ''[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]''.{{cite web |last=Cogan |first=Marin |url=http://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2017/02/ivanka-trump-womens-magazines-fashion-214819 |title=How Do You Solve a Problem Like Ivanka? |website=[[Politico]] |date=February 27, 2017|access-date=July 2, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170711030248/http://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2017/02/ivanka-trump-womens-magazines-fashion-214819 |archivedate=July 11, 2017 }}{{cite web |last=Van Meter |first=Jonathan |url=http://www.vogue.com/article/ivanka-trump-collection-the-apprentice-family |title=Ivanka Trump Knows What It Means to Be a Modern Millennial |website=Vogue |date=February 25, 2015|access-date=July 15, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170708005308/http://www.vogue.com/article/ivanka-trump-collection-the-apprentice-family |archivedate=July 8, 2017 }} She was featured on the cover of ''[[Stuff (magazine)|Stuff]]'' in August 2006 and again in September 2007.{{cite web |first=Bill |last=Keith |title=Ivanka on Top |date=September 2006 |website=Stuff Magazine |url=http://www.stuffmagazine.com/cover%5Fgirls/girl.aspx?id=558 |accessdate=August 17, 2006 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060820130827/http://www.stuffmagazine.com/cover_girls/girl.aspx?id=558 |archivedate=August 20, 2006}} ===Television=== ====''The Apprentice''==== In 2006, Trump filled in for [[Carolyn Kepcher]] on five episodes of her father's television program ''[[The Apprentice (US Season 5)|The Apprentice 5]]'', first appearing to help judge the [[The Apprentice (U.S. season 5)#Week 2: The Razor.27s Edge|Gillette task in week 2]].{{cite web |url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/11645069/ |title=Ivanka Trump to appear on 'Apprentice' |agency=Associated Press |publisher=MSNBC |date=March 2, 2006 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060415010630/http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/11645069/ |archivedate=April 15, 2006 }} Like Kepcher, Trump visited the site of the tasks and spoke to the teams. Trump collaborated with season 5 winner [[Sean Yazbeck]] on his winner's project of choice, [[Trump SoHo]] Hotel-Condominium.{{cite press release |url=http://www.trumpsohohotel.com/_files/pdf/SoHo_Pre_Opening.pdf |format=PDF |title=Trump Soho New York, First Ultra‐luxury High‐rise Hotel in Downtown New York, To Open Fall 2009 |publisher=Trump Hotel Collection |date=January 7, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090220024549/http://www.trumpsohohotel.com/_files/pdf/SoHo_Pre_Opening.pdf |archivedate=February 20, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://www.trumpsoho.com/flash/download/press/st1.pdf |via=TrumpSOHO.com |title=Trump kids bet on rich Europeans to back New York hotel/condo |date=June 29, 2008 |publisher=Times Online |format=PDF |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090220053800/http://www.trumpsoho.com/flash/download/press/st1.pdf |archivedate=February 20, 2009}}Brown, Joel, [http://addicted2success.com/success-advice/10-things-that-women-entrepreneurs-can-learn-from-ivanka-trump/ "10 Things That Women Entrepreneurs Can Learn From 'Ivanka Trump'"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161226034623/http://addicted2success.com/success-advice/10-things-that-women-entrepreneurs-can-learn-from-ivanka-trump/ |date=December 26, 2016}}, addicted2success.com. Retrieved November 16, 2016. She replaced Kepcher as a primary boardroom judge during the [[The Apprentice (U.S. Season 6)|sixth season of ''The Apprentice'']] and its follow-up iteration, ''[[The Apprentice (U.S. Season 7)|The Celebrity Apprentice]]''.{{citation needed|date=July 2018}} ====Other TV appearances==== In 1997, at the age of just 15, Trump co-hosted the [[Miss Teen USA]] Pageant, which was partially owned by her father, Donald Trump, from 1996 to 2005. In 2006, she was a guest judge on [[Project Runway (season 3)|Project Runway's third season]] and on season 4 of ''[[Project Runway All Stars (season 4)|Project Runway All Stars]]''.{{cite news |url=http://gothamist.com/2006/07/28/project_runway_3.php |title=Project Runway 3: Dog Days! |publisher=''[[Gothamist]]'' |date=July 28, 2006 |first=Jen |last=Chung |quote=It's runway time, and Vera Wang is sitting in for Michael Kors again and the guest judge is Ivanka Trump. |access-date=July 8, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326041736/http://gothamist.com/2006/07/28/project_runway_3.php |archive-date=March 26, 2018 |dead-url=yes }}{{cite news |url=http://ew.com/recap/project-runway-all-stars-season-4-premiere/2/ |title=Project Runway All Stars season premiere recap: 'Project Runway All Stars' season 4 premiere recap |publisher=''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' |date=October 31, 2014 |first=Dalene |last=Rovenstine |quote=And host/judge Alyssa, judges Isaac Mizrahi and Georgina Chapman, and guest judge Ivanka Trump agree: They pick the mens' collection.}}{{cite news |url=https://www.bustle.com/articles/50156-project-runway-all-stars-guest-judge-nina-garcia-wont-be-easy-to-please |title='Project Runway All Stars' Guest Judge Nina Garcia Won't be Easy To Please |publisher=''[[Bustle (magazine)|Bustle]]'' |first=Danielle |last=Santola |date=November 20, 2014 |quote=With Project Runway: All Stars in its fourth season, guest judges are getting more and more interesting. So far, we've seen celebrity guest judges like Donald Trump's model daughter Ivanka Trump, Jersey Shore's resident party girls Snooki and JWoww and legendary fashion designer Betsey Johnson.}} In 2010, Trump and her husband briefly portrayed themselves in Season 4 Episode 6 of ''[[Gossip Girl (TV series)|Gossip Girl]]''.{{cite web |last1=Elizabeth |first1=De |title=You Totally Forgot Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner's Cameo on 'Gossip Girl' |url=http://www.teenvogue.com/story/ivanka-trump-jared-kushner-cameo-gossip-girl |website=Teen Vogue |accessdate=July 15, 2017 |language=en |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170504190237/http://www.teenvogue.com/story/ivanka-trump-jared-kushner-cameo-gossip-girl |archivedate=May 4, 2017 }} ===Books=== In October 2009, Trump's first [[self-help]] book, ''[[The Trump Card: Playing to Win in Work and Life]],'' was published; according to [[ghostwriter]] [[Daniel Paisner]], he co-wrote the book.{{cite web |last1=Tolentino |first1=Jia |title=Ivanka Trump's Terrible Book Helps Explain the Trump-Family Ethos |url=http://www.newyorker.com/books/second-read/ivanka-trumps-terrible-book-helps-explain-the-trump-family-ethos |date=November 29, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170807235828/http://www.newyorker.com/books/second-read/ivanka-trumps-terrible-book-helps-explain-the-trump-family-ethos |archivedate=August 7, 2017 }}{{cite web|last=Paisner|first=Daniel |url=http://www.danielpaisner.com/works.htm|title=Here's a run-down of some of Daniel Paisner's Hits and Misses|access-date=December 13, 2017}} In May 2017, her second [[self-help]] book, ''[[Women Who Work: Rewriting the Rules for Success]]'', was published; she used the services of a writer, a researcher, and a fact-checker.{{cite web |last=Fahrenthold |first=David A. |title=Ivanka Trump donates half the advance from her new book |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2017/05/12/ivanka-trump-donates-half-the-royalties-from-her-new-book/ |website=The Washington Post |date=May 12, 2017|access-date= June 28, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170517074758/https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2017/05/12/ivanka-trump-donates-half-the-royalties-from-her-new-book/ |archivedate=May 17, 2017 }}{{cite web |last1=Senior |first1=Jennifer |title=Having Trouble Having It All? Ivanka Alone Can Fix It |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/02/books/review-ivanka-trump-women-who-work.html |website=The New York Times |date=May 2, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170511014721/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/02/books/review-ivanka-trump-women-who-work.html |archivedate=May 11, 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2017/05/03/women-featured-in-ivanka-trumps-new-book-react-dont-use-my-story/ |title=Woman featured in Ivanka Trump's new book reacts: 'Don't use my story' |last=Paquette |first=Danielle |website=[[The Washington Post]] |date=May 3, 2017}} ==Political involvement and role in the Trump administration== ===2016 presidential campaign and election=== In 2015, she publicly endorsed [[Donald Trump presidential campaign, 2016|her father's presidential campaign]]. She was involved with the campaign by making public appearances to support him.{{cite journal |first=Tierney |last=McAfee |url=http://www.people.com/article/melania-trump-donald-trump-campaign-trail |title=Melania Trump Makes Her First Appearance on Campaign Trail... |journal=People |date=November 25, 2015| access-date= December 29, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151208184749/http://www.people.com/article/melania-trump-donald-trump-campaign-trail |archivedate=December 8, 2015 }} and defending him.{{cite web |url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/12/29/politics/ivanka-trump-donald-town-country/index.html |title=Ivanka Trump: Dad '100 percent believes in equality of gender' |date=December 29, 2015 |publisher=CNN |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151229211830/http://www.cnn.com/2015/12/29/politics/ivanka-trump-donald-town-country/index.html |archivedate=December 29, 2015 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/06/24/politics/donald-trump-ivanka-trump-mexicans-immigrants/index.html |title=Trump stands by immigration remarks, blames media |date=June 24, 2015 |first=Cassie |last=Spodak |publisher=CNN |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151230220531/http://www.cnn.com/2015/06/24/politics/donald-trump-ivanka-trump-mexicans-immigrants/index.html |archivedate=December 30, 2015 }} However, she admitted mixed feelings about his presidential ambitions, saying, in October 2015, "As a citizen, I love what he's doing. As a daughter, it's obviously more complicated."{{cite web |url=http://www.politico.com/story/2015/10/ivanka-trump-on-donald-trumps-2016-presidential-run-214783 |title=Ivanka Trump on how she feels about her dad's run: It's complicated |date=October 14, 2015 |publisher=Politico |first=Eliza |last=Collins |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151228220341/http://www.politico.com/story/2015/10/ivanka-trump-on-donald-trumps-2016-presidential-run-214783 |archivedate=December 28, 2015 }} In August 2015, Donald Trump stated that she was his leading advisor on "women's health and women" and said it was she who propelled him to elaborate on his views of women.{{cite web |url=http://www.newsmax.com/US/ivanka-trump-fathers-confidant/2015/08/13/id/669963/ |title=Ivanka Trump: The Woman Donald Trump Cherishes Most |date=August 13, 2015 |publisher=Newsmax.com |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160126210047/http://www.newsmax.com/US/ivanka-trump-fathers-confidant/2015/08/13/id/669963/ |archivedate=January 26, 2016 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.detroitnews.com/story/life/2015/08/18/woman-trump-cherishes-daughter-ivanka/31955397/ |title=The woman Trump cherishes most is daughter Ivanka |first=Melinda |last=Henneberger |website=[[The Detroit News]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160125222255/http://www.detroitnews.com/story/life/2015/08/18/woman-trump-cherishes-daughter-ivanka/31955397/ |archivedate=January 25, 2016 }} [[File:Ivanka Trump at Aston PA on September 13th, 2016 01 (cropped).jpg|thumb|left|upright|Trump speaks about child-care policy during the 2016 presidential campaign. (September 13, 2016 in [[Aston, PA]])]] In January 2016, Trump was featured in a radio ad which aired in the early voting states of [[Iowa]] and [[New Hampshire]], in which she praised her father.{{cite web |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/onpolitics/2016/01/18/ivanka-trump-my-dad-best/78960650/ |title=Ivanka Trump: My dad is the best! |website=USA Today |date=January 18, 2016 |first=Donovan |last=Slack|access-date=September 29, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160611043321/http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/onpolitics/2016/01/18/ivanka-trump-my-dad-best/78960650/ |archivedate=June 11, 2016 }}{{cite web |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/donald-trump-radio-ad-features-daughter-ivanka/story?id=36355938 |title=New Donald Trump Radio Ad Features Daughter Ivanka |first=Veronica |last=Stracqualursi |date=January 18, 2016 |publisher=ABC News|access-date=September 29, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160516170320/http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/donald-trump-radio-ad-features-daughter-ivanka/story?id=36355938 |archivedate=May 16, 2016 }} She appeared by his side following the results of early voting states in 2016, in particular briefly speaking in [[South Carolina]].{{cite web |url=http://komonews.com/news/elections/trump-declares-victory-in-south-carolina-primary |first=Amanda |last=Ota |title=Trump declares victory in South Carolina primary |date=February 20, 2016 |publisher=[[KOMO (AM)|KOMO]] |location=Washington |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160222093416/http://komonews.com/news/elections/trump-declares-victory-in-south-carolina-primary |archivedate=February 22, 2016 }}{{cite web |url=http://townhall.com/tipsheet/justinholcomb/2016/02/20/victory-speech-trump-sacks-bush-country-dominates-the-first-southern-state-n2122527 |title=Victory Speech, Trump Sacks 'Bush Country', Dominates the First Southern State |date=February 20, 2016 |publisher=townhall.com |first=Justin |last=Holcomb |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160222041726/http://townhall.com/tipsheet/justinholcomb/2016/02/20/victory-speech-trump-sacks-bush-country-dominates-the-first-southern-state-n2122527 |archivedate=February 22, 2016 }} She was not able to vote in the New York primary in April 2016 because she had missed the October 2015 deadline to change her registration from independent to Republican.{{cite web |url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/04/11/politics/donald-trump-ivanka-vice-president/index.html |title=Trump children unable to vote for dad in NY primary |first=Tom |last=LoBianco |publisher=CNN |date=April 11, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160711222141/http://www.cnn.com/2016/04/11/politics/donald-trump-ivanka-vice-president/index.html |archivedate=July 11, 2016 }} Trump introduced her father in a speech immediately before his own speech at the [[2016 Republican National Convention]] (RNC) in July.{{cite web |last1=Serfaty |first1=Sunlen |title=Ivanka Trump delivers in prime-time |url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/07/21/politics/ivanka-trump-republican-convention-speech/ |accessdate=July 22, 2016 |publisher=CNN |date=July 22, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160722122655/http://www.cnn.com/2016/07/21/politics/ivanka-trump-republican-convention-speech/ |archivedate=July 22, 2016 }} The [[George Harrison]] song "[[Here Comes the Sun]]" was used as her entrance music. She stated: "One of my father's greatest talents is the ability to see the potential in people", and said he would "[[Make America Great Again]]".{{cite web |title=Coverage of the Republican Convention. Aired 10-11p ET |url=http://transcripts.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/1607/21/se.03.html |publisher=CNN |accessdate=November 29, 2016 |quote=As the proud daughter of your nominee, I am here to tell you that this is the moment and Donald Trump is the person to make America great again! |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161130184515/http://transcripts.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/1607/21/se.03.html |archivedate=November 30, 2016 }} Her speech was well received as portraying Donald Trump "in a warmer-than-usual light", according to the ''Washington Post''.{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-fix/wp/2016/07/23/ivanka-trump-continues-to-impress-the-media-her-father-feuds-with/ |first=Callum |last=Borchers |title=Ivanka Trump continues to impress the media that her father feuds with |website=The Washington Post |date=July 23, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160724163355/https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-fix/wp/2016/07/23/ivanka-trump-continues-to-impress-the-media-her-father-feuds-with/ |archivedate=July 24, 2016 }} An earlier ''Post'' article had questioned whether the policy positions Ivanka Trump espoused were closer to those of [[Hillary Clinton]] than to those of her father.Bump, Philip, [https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-fix/wp/2016/07/22/who-exactly-was-ivanka-trump-endorsing/ "Who, exactly, was Ivanka Trump endorsing?"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161116231017/https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-fix/wp/2016/07/22/who-exactly-was-ivanka-trump-endorsing/ |date=November 16, 2016}}, ''The Washington Post'', July 22, 2016. Retrieved November 16, 2016. After the speech, the George Harrison estate complained about the use of his song as being offensive to their wishes.{{cite web |first1=Paul |last1=Owen |first2=Scott |last2=Bixby |title='The greatest asset Trump has': Ivanka gets rave reviews for Cleveland speech |url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2016/jul/22/ivanka-trump-republican-national-convention-speech |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |accessdate=July 23, 2016 |date=July 23, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160723175504/https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2016/jul/22/ivanka-trump-republican-national-convention-speech |archivedate=July 23, 2016 }} The next morning, Ivanka's official Twitter account tweeted, "Shop Ivanka's look from her #RNC speech" with a link to a [[Macy's]] page that featured the dress she wore.{{cite web |first=Robin |last=Abcarian |title=In the Trump family tradition, Ivanka uses her moment in the spotlight to hawk her wares |url=http://www.latimes.com/politics/la-na-pol-ivanka-dress-20160722-snap-story.html |website=[[Los Angeles Times]] |accessdate=July 22, 2016 |date=July 22, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160723214732/http://www.latimes.com/politics/la-na-pol-ivanka-dress-20160722-snap-story.html |archivedate=July 23, 2016 }} After her father's election, Trump wore a bracelet on a family appearance with the president-elect on ''[[60 Minutes]]''. Her company then used an [[Email marketing|email blast]] to promote the appearance of the bracelet. After critiques for "[[Monetization#Revenue from business operations|monetization]]", the company quickly apologized calling the publicity the work of "a well-intentioned marketing employee at one of our companies who was following customary protocol". A spokeswoman said that the company was, post-election, "proactively discussing new policies and procedures with all of our partners going forward".{{cite web |last=Dziemianowicz |first=Joe |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/life-style/ivanka-trump-company-apologizes-hawking-interview-bracelet-article-1.2874321 |title=Ivanka Trump's jewelry company apologizes for hawking bracelet worn on '60 Minutes' |website=[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]] |location=New York |date=November 15, 2016 |accessdate=November 16, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161116151001/http://www.nydailynews.com/life-style/ivanka-trump-company-apologizes-hawking-interview-bracelet-article-1.2874321 |archivedate=November 16, 2016 }}Eaglesham, Jean, and Lisa Schwartz, [https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-ivanka-trump-is-a-walking-billboard-for-her-namesake-fashion-business-1514389465 "How Ivanka Trump Is a Walking Billboard for Her Namesake Fashion Business"] {{subscription}}, Wall Street Journal, December 27, 2017. "The president's daughter and adviser put the company into a trust, but continues to wear its merchandise, feeding a publicity machine": sub-head. Retrieved December 27, 2017. Ivanka Trump has collected the work of artists who have protested to her directly following her father's election victory. In January 2017, artist [[Richard Prince]] returned a $36,000 payment he received for a work featuring Ivanka and disavowed its creation.{{cite web |last=Kennedy |first=Randy |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/12/arts/design/richard-prince-protesting-trump-returns-art-payment.html |title=Richard Prince, Protesting Trump, Returns Art Payment |website=[[New York Times]] |location=New York |date=January 12, 2017 |accessdate=January 12, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170113143635/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/12/arts/design/richard-prince-protesting-trump-returns-art-payment.html |archivedate=January 13, 2017 }} Other artists joined behind a movement created by the Halt Action Group called @dear_ivanka, which aimed to change Trump's policies by appealing to Ivanka. Among its supporters were contemporary artist [[Alex Da Corte]] who told Trump to stay away from his paintings after she appeared in front of one on a social media post.{{cite web |last=Heyward |first=Anna |url=http://www.newyorker.com/culture/culture-desk/dear-ivanka-new-york-citys-artists-appeal-to-ivanka-trump-peer-to-peer |title="Dear Ivanka": New York City's Artists Appeal to Ivanka Trump, Peer to Peer |website=[[The New Yorker|New Yorker]] |location=New York |date=November 30, 2016 |accessdate=January 12, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170201123808/http://www.newyorker.com/culture/culture-desk/dear-ivanka-new-york-citys-artists-appeal-to-ivanka-trump-peer-to-peer |archivedate=February 1, 2017 }}{{cite web |last=Freeman |first=Nate |url=http://www.artnews.com/2017/03/07/disowning-ivanka-the-art-world-stares-down-the-first-daughter/ |title=Disowning Ivanka: The Art World Stares Down the First Daughter |website=Artnews |location=New York |date=March 7, 2017 |accessdate=March 7, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170307124914/http://www.artnews.com/2017/03/07/disowning-ivanka-the-art-world-stares-down-the-first-daughter/ |archivedate=March 7, 2017}} On Friday, January 20, 2017, she attended the [[inauguration of Donald Trump]] as the [[45th President of the United States]], at the [[United States Capitol Building]] in [[Washington, D.C.]]. ===Advisor to the President of the United States=== After Donald Trump's election, rumors swirled about the future role that Ivanka would play in her father's administration. In early 2017, she stepped down from her post at the [[Trump Organization]]; the organization also removed images of Ivanka Trump and Donald Trump from their websites, in accordance with official advice on federal ethics rules.{{cite web |last1=Yourish |first1=Karen |last2=Andrews |first2=Wilson |title=Before and After: Removing Donald J. Trump From the Trump Brand |url=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/01/18/us/politics/trump-brand-before-after.html |website=The New York Times |date=January 18, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170120181651/https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/01/18/us/politics/trump-brand-before-after.html |archivedate=January 20, 2017 }} In the early months of [[Trump administration|her father's presidency]], some commented that she was filling a quasi-[[First Lady of the United States|First Lady]] role{{cite web |last1=Rosen |first1=Ben |title=Ivanka Trump: a first daughter with the office of first lady? |url=http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2016/1215/Ivanka-Trump-a-first-daughter-with-the-office-of-first-lady |website=Christian Science Monitor |date=December 15, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170114084911/http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2016/1215/Ivanka-Trump-a-first-daughter-with-the-office-of-first-lady |archivedate=January 14, 2017 }} while First Lady [[Melania Trump]] remained in New York City (her son [[Barron Trump|Barron]] completed the school year in New York before the First Lady moved to Washington); Ivanka Trump stated that she had no intention of being First Lady.{{cite web |last1=Effron |first1=Lauren |last2=Santucci |first2=John |title=Ivanka Trump Says She Will Not Be Filling in as First Lady |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/ivanka-trump-filling-lady-trump-administration/story?id=44871559 |website=ABC News |date=January 20, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170121000101/http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/ivanka-trump-filling-lady-trump-administration/story?id=44871559 |archivedate=January 21, 2017 }}{{cite web |last1=Bryant |first1=Kenzie |title=Ivanka Trump Dismisses Suggestions That She'll Act as First Lady |url=http://www.vanityfair.com/style/2017/01/ivanka-trump-first-lady-inappropriate |website=Vanities |date=January 19, 2017 |language=en}} [[File:TrumpSignsHR321InspireWomenAct28FEB2017.jpg|thumb|left|Trump (fourth from right) attending the signing ceremony for the [[INSPIRE Women Act]] on Tuesday, February 28, 2017, in the [[Oval Office]] of the White House]] After advising her father in an unofficial capacity for the first two months of his administration, she was appointed Advisor to the President, a government employee, on March 29, 2017. She takes no salary. Prior to becoming a federal employee, she used a personal email for government work.{{cite web |title=Exclusive: Ivanka Trump used a personal email account after inauguration |url=http://www.newsweek.com/ivanka-trump-personal-email-account-white-house-670700 |website=Newsweek |accessdate=September 25, 2017 |language=en |date=September 25, 2017}} Amid the contentious early months of her father's administration, some commentators compared her role in the administration to that of [[Julie Nixon Eisenhower]], daughter of President [[Richard Nixon]]. Julie was one of the Nixon administration's most vocal defenders, and Trump defended the Trump administration and her father personally against a myriad of allegations.{{cite web |last1=Rosenberg |first1=Alyssa |title=Ivanka Trump and the Cult of the First Daughter |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/ivanka-trump-and-the-cult-of-the-first-daughter/2017/04/07/273c870c-1bd2-11e7-bcc2-7d1a0973e7b2_story.html |website=Washington Post |date=April 7, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170630172148/https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/ivanka-trump-and-the-cult-of-the-first-daughter/2017/04/07/273c870c-1bd2-11e7-bcc2-7d1a0973e7b2_story.html |archivedate=June 30, 2017 }}{{cite web |last1=O'Connor |first1=Kyrie |title=The president's daughter, then and now |url=http://www.houstonchronicle.com/local/gray-matters/article/The-president-s-daughter-then-and-now-11016799.php |website=Houston Chronicle |date=March 21, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170709025222/http://www.houstonchronicle.com/local/gray-matters/article/The-president-s-daughter-then-and-now-11016799.php |archivedate=July 9, 2017 }} ''Washington Post'' opinion columnist Alyssa Rosenberg wrote, "Both daughters served as important validators for their fathers." In early April 2017, the government of China extended trademarks to Trump's businesses.[[David Remnick|Remnick, David]], [http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2017/05/01/a-hundred-days-of-trump "A Hundred Days of Trump"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170426042528/http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2017/05/01/a-hundred-days-of-trump |date=April 26, 2017}}, ''[[The New Yorker (magazine)|The New Yorker]]'', May 1, 2017 issue. Retrieved April 23, 2017. On the same day, Donald Trump hosted [[President of the People's Republic of China|Chinese President]] [[Xi Jinping]] at [[Mar-a-Lago#The Mar-a-Lago Club|Mar-A-Lago]] and Trump and Kushner sat next to the Chinese leader and his wife [[Peng Liyuan]]Bennett, Brian, and Noah Bierman, [http://www.latimes.com/politics/la-fg-trump-china-20170407-story.html "China's President Xi gets an awkward front-row seat to U.S. military might"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170426042932/http://www.latimes.com/politics/la-fg-trump-china-20170407-story.html |date=April 26, 2017}}, ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'', April 7, 2017. Retrieved April 23, 2017. at the [[State dinner#United States|state dinner]].Webb, Kristina, [http://www.palmbeachpost.com/news/new-the-mar-lago-dining-room-where-trump-will-have-dinner/7s1mGg64EdrtT1DxIZ6dMN/ "New: The Mar-a-Lago dining room where Trump, Xi will have dinner"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170426062817/http://www.palmbeachpost.com/news/new-the-mar-lago-dining-room-where-trump-will-have-dinner/7s1mGg64EdrtT1DxIZ6dMN/ |date=April 26, 2017}}, ''[[Palm Beach Post]]'', April 6, 2017. Retrieved April 24, 2017.[https://www.yahoo.com/news/trump-gave-syria-attack-order-during-dessert-155408225.html "Trump gave Syria attack order 'during dessert'"] [[Agence France Presse|AFP]] via 'Yahoo News'', April 12, 2017. Retrieved April 23, 2017. Also during the visit, Trump and Kushner's five-year-old daughter Arabella "sang a traditional Chinese song, in Mandarin, [for Xi]. The video, which was lavishly praised by Chinese state media, played over 2.2 million times on China's popular news portal", [[Tencent QQ]].Kinetz, Erika, and Anne D'Innocenzio, [http://www.newsmax.com/Finance/StreetTalk/ivanka-trump-brand-business-politics/2017/04/18/id/784913/ "Ivanka Trump's Brand Prospers as Politics Mixes With Business"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170426060753/http://www.newsmax.com/Finance/StreetTalk/ivanka-trump-brand-business-politics/2017/04/18/id/784913/ |date=April 26, 2017}}, [[Associated Press|AP]] via ''[[NewsMax]]'', April 18, 2017. [[By-line]] via ''[http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/A/AS_BRAND_IVANKA_ASOL-?SITE=AP&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT hosted.ap.org] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170419072749/http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/A/AS_BRAND_IVANKA_ASOL-?SITE=AP&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT |date=April 19, 2017}}'' (April 19). Retrieved April 23, 2017. [[File:Angela Merkel, Ivanka Trump and Chrystia Freeland at the W20 Conference Gala Dinner.jpg|thumb|[[Angela Merkel]], Ivanka Trump, and [[Chrystia Freeland]] at the W20 Conference Gala Dinner in [[Berlin]], April 2017]] In late April 2017, Trump hired Julie Radford as her chief of staff. Before the end of the month, Trump and Radford had plans to travel with [[Dina Powell]] and [[Hope Hicks]] to the first [[List of G20 summits#W20 Summit|W20 women's summit]]. The W20 was organized by the National Council of German Women's Organizations and the Association of German Women Entrepreneurs[http://www.newsmax.com/Politics/ivanka-trump-hires-chief-of-staff/2017/04/21/id/785766/ "Ivanka Trump Hires Chief of Staff"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170424175124/http://www.newsmax.com/Politics/ivanka-trump-hires-chief-of-staff/2017/04/21/id/785766/ |date=April 24, 2017}}, ''NewsMax'', April 21, 2017. Citing and linking to: Annie Karni, [http://www.politico.com/story/2017/04/21/julie-radford-chief-of-staff-ivanka-trump-237454 "Ivanka Trump has hired a chief of staff who worked in former President George W. Bush's administration"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170426130353/http://www.politico.com/story/2017/04/21/julie-radford-chief-of-staff-ivanka-trump-237454 |date=April 26, 2017}}, ''Politico'', April 21, 2017. Retrieved April 23, 2017.{{cite web |url=http://www.w20-germany.org/de/die-w20/delegierte-w20-beraterinnen/ |title=Delegates & W20 Advisors |accessdate=June 10, 2017}} as one of the preparatory meetings leading up to the [[2017 G20 Hamburg summit|G20 head-of-state]] summit in July. At the conference, Trump spoke about women's rights; she was booed by the audience when she praised her father as an advocate for women.{{cite web |last1=Scott |first1=Eugene |last2=Klein |first2=Betsy |title=German crowd hisses, boos at Ivanka when she defends her dad |url=http://www.cnn.com/2017/04/25/politics/ivanka-trump-germany-hisses/ |website=CNN |date=April 25, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170522054743/http://www.cnn.com/2017/04/25/politics/ivanka-trump-germany-hisses/ |archivedate=May 22, 2017 }}{{cite web |last1=Levits |first1=Eric |title=Ivanka Trump Booed While Praising Her Father in Germany |url=http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2017/04/ivanka-trump-booed-while-praising-her-father-in-germany.html |website=New York Magazine |date=April 25, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170522075949/http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2017/04/ivanka-trump-booed-while-praising-her-father-in-germany.html |archivedate=May 22, 2017 }} In a recent announcement, Donald Trump said that his daughter will lead the U.S. delegation to India this fall in a global support of women's entrepreneurship. In response to this announcement, an Indian diplomat was quoted as stating: "We regard Ivanka Trump the way we do half-wit Saudi princes. It's in our national interest to flatter them."{{Cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/ivanka-trump-india-summit-name-and-location-of-summit-half-wit-saudi-arabia-prince-us-delegation-a7887731.html |title=Indian diplomat says what no one else will about Ivanka Trump |date=August 11, 2017 |website=The Independent |language=en-GB |access-date=August 11, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170811113443/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/ivanka-trump-india-summit-name-and-location-of-summit-half-wit-saudi-arabia-prince-us-delegation-a7887731.html |archivedate=August 11, 2017}} Biographer and journalist Michael Wolff wrote a book that is based on numerous interviews with members of Donald Trump's circle. In an extract of this book, Wolff claims—but cites no sources—that Trump and her husband have reached a deal that "[i]f sometime in the future the opportunity arose, she'd be the one to run for president".{{cite news|title = Donald Trump Didn't Want to Be President| url = http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2018/01/michael-wolff-fire-and-fury-book-donald-trump.html|work = New York magazine|date = January 3, 2018| access-date = January 3, 2018}} She has also received criticism on Twitter for acting as Secretary of State after the firing of [[Rex Tillerson]] by meeting with the South Korean foreign minister.{{cite news|title=Ivanka Trump takes heat for acting as secretary of state: 'This is blatant nepotism' |url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/ivanka-trump-takes-heat-acting-secretary-state-blatant-nepotism-012552030.html|agency=Yahoo|date=March 16, 2018}} In November 2018, ''The Washington Post'' reported that Trump conducted official government business through her personal email, possibly in violation of federal records rules, which require such communication to be sent within 20 days to a work account for permanent archival. A spokesman for Trump's ethics counsel stated that before she was told of the rules, "Trump sometimes used her personal account, almost always for logistics and scheduling concerning her family", and that the emails did not have classified information.{{cite news |last1=Leonnig |first1=Carol D. |last2=Dawsey |first2=Josh |title=Ivanka Trump used a personal email account to send hundreds of emails about government business last year |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/ivanka-trump-used-a-personal-email-account-to-send-hundreds-of-emails-about-government-business-last-year/2018/11/19/6515d1e0-e7a1-11e8-a939-9469f1166f9d_story.html |accessdate=20 November 2018 |work=The Washington Post |date=19 November 2018}}{{cite news |title=Ivanka used personal email for WH business |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-46271021 |publisher=BBC News |date=20 November 2018}} ==Social and political causes== [[File:Seeds of Peace 2009 (b).jpg|thumb|right|Trump at [[Seeds of Peace]] in February 2009]] In July 2016, at the [[2016 Republican National Convention|Republican National Convention]], Trump said of her political views: "Like many of my fellow [[millennials]], I do not consider myself categorically Republican or Democrat."{{cite web |url=http://www.bustle.com/articles/174190-transcript-of-ivanka-trumps-rnc-speech-highlights-how-dedicated-she-is-to-her-dad |title=Transcript of Ivanka Trump's RNC Speech Highlights How Dedicated She Is To Her Dad |last=Al-Sibai |first=Noor |date=July 21, 2016 |publisher=|access-date= |website=[[Bustle (magazine)|Bustle]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160727021754/http://www.bustle.com/articles/174190-transcript-of-ivanka-trumps-rnc-speech-highlights-how-dedicated-she-is-to-her-dad |archivedate=July 27, 2016 }} In 2007, Trump donated $1,000 to the presidential campaign of [[Hillary Clinton]].{{cite web |last1=Yoon |first1=Robert |title=Celebrities ante up for Democratic campaigns |url=http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/04/16/celebrity.contributions/index.html |accessdate=July 10, 2015 |publisher=CNN |date=April 23, 2007 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150624152440/http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/04/16/celebrity.contributions/index.html |archivedate=June 24, 2015 }} In 2012, Trump endorsed [[Mitt Romney]] for president.{{cite web |last1=Heinze |first1=Christian |title=Ivanka Trump endorses Romney, praises his 'business intelligence' |url=http://thehill.com/video/campaign/218769-ivanka-trump-endorses-romney-praises-his-business-intelligence |accessdate=July 10, 2015 |website=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]] |date=March 28, 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150622195717/http://thehill.com/video/campaign/218769-ivanka-trump-endorses-romney-praises-his-business-intelligence |archivedate=June 22, 2015 }} In 2013, Trump and her husband hosted a fundraiser for Democrat [[Cory Booker]], and the couple bundled more than $40,000 for Booker's [[U.S. Senate]] campaign.{{cite web |last1=Wiersema |first1=Alisa |title=Ivanka Trump Switches Teams For Cory Booker |url=http://abcnews.go.com/blogs/politics/2013/07/ivanka-trump-switches-teams-for-cory-booker/ |accessdate=July 10, 2015 |publisher=ABC News |date=July 17, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150711182655/http://abcnews.go.com/blogs/politics/2013/07/ivanka-trump-switches-teams-for-cory-booker/ |archivedate=July 11, 2015 }} Trump says she is an advocate for women and Israel. ===Philanthropy=== Trump has ties to a number of Jewish charities, including [[Chai Lifeline]], a charity which helps to look after children with [[cancer]].Donn, Jeff, [http://www.timesofisrael.com/jewish-charities-benefit-as-eric-trump-foundation-flouts-standards-to-favor-pet-projects Jewish charities benefit as Eric Trump Foundation flouts standards to favor pet projects] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170410052859/http://www.timesofisrael.com/jewish-charities-benefit-as-eric-trump-foundation-flouts-standards-to-favor-pet-projects/ |date=April 10, 2017}}, ''Times of Israel'', December 23, 2016. Other charities she supports include [[United Hatzalah]], to which her father, Donald Trump, has made six-figure donations in the past.Schmid, Shira, [http://www.jpost.com/Opinion/Ivanka-Trump-and-Shabbat-Pure-family-time-472181 "Ivanka Trump and Shabbat: Pure-family-time] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170408210038/http://www.jpost.com/Opinion/Ivanka-Trump-and-Shabbat-Pure-family-time-472181 |date=April 8, 2017}}, ''Jerusalem Post'', November 9, 2016.Ain, Stewart, [http://jewishweek.timesofisrael.com/trumps-jewish-giving-rubs-against-tenor-of-his-campaign Trump's Jewish Giving Rubs Against Tenor Of His Campaign] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170410074343/http://jewishweek.timesofisrael.com/trumps-jewish-giving-rubs-against-tenor-of-his-campaign/ |date=April 10, 2017}}, ''jewishweek.timesofisrael.com'', March 30, 2016. After she was appointed Advisor to the President, Trump donated the unpaid half of the advance payments for her book ''Women Who Work: Rewriting the Rules for Success'' to the [[National Urban League]] and the [[Boys and Girls Clubs of America]]. She further said that any royalties exceeding the advances will also be given to charity. ==Personal life== [[File:Boeing 787-10 rollout with President Trump (33109589936) (Jared and Ivanka).jpg|thumb|left|Kushner and Trump at an event in [[North Charleston, South Carolina]], February 2017]] In January 2017, it was announced that Trump and her husband had made arrangements to establish a family home in the [[Kalorama, Washington, D.C.|Kalorama]] neighborhood of Washington, DC.{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonian.com/2017/01/03/ivanka-trump-will-move-house-kalorama/ |title=Ivanka Trump Will Move into a House in Kalorama |first=Marisa |last=Kashino |date=January 3, 2017 |publisher=[[Washingtonian (magazine)|Washingtonian]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170104143828/https://www.washingtonian.com/2017/01/03/ivanka-trump-will-move-house-kalorama/ |archivedate=January 4, 2017 }} Federal filings implied that, in 2017, Trump and her husband may have assets upwards of $740 million.Hallemann, Caroline, [http://www.townandcountrymag.com/society/money-and-power/a9218201/jared-and-ivanka-net-worth "Here's What Jared and Ivanka Are Really Worth"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170410213919/http://www.townandcountrymag.com/society/money-and-power/a9218201/jared-and-ivanka-net-worth/ |date=April 10, 2017}}, ''[[Town and Country Magazine]]'', April 1, 2017. According to her mother, Ivanka Trump speaks French and understands [[Czech language|Czech]].{{cite web |title=Ivana Trump Now Fashions Herself As Plaza's Innkeeper |url=http://articles.mcall.com/1989-05-14/features/2690591_1_trump-tower-skis-trump-castle/2 |first=Polly |last=Rayner |publisher=The Morning Call |date=May 14, 1989 |accessdate=August 11, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160804065645/http://articles.mcall.com/1989-05-14/features/2690591_1_trump-tower-skis-trump-castle/2 |archivedate=August 4, 2016 }} [[Sarah Ellison]] writing for ''Vanity Fair'' in 2018 indicated that Ivanka Trump was the family member whom "everyone in the family seems to acknowledge" is Donald Trump's "favorite" child.{{cite web |last1=Ellison |first1=Sarah |authorlink1= Sarah Ellison |title=Inside Ivanka and Tiffany Trump's Complicated Sister Act |url= https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2016/12/inside-ivanka-trump-and-tiffany-trump-complicated-sister-act |website=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]] |accessdate=July 7, 2018 |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20161224142406/https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2016/12/inside-ivanka-trump-and-tiffany-trump-complicated-sister-act |archivedate= December 24, 2016 |quote=Kushner is married to Trump's favorite child, his daughter Ivanka.}} This was previously confirmed by the family members themselves in an interview with [[Barbara Walters]] on network television from 2015 where the siblings were gathered together and acknowledged that she was the favorite among the siblings.[[Barbara Walters]]. ABC Network 20/20 Interview of the Trump family. 11-20-2015. . ===Relationships=== During college, Trump was in a nearly four-year relationship with Greg Hersch, an investment banker at [[Salomon Brothers]], [[Bear Stearns]], and UBS.{{cite web |url=https://www.gq.com/women/photos/200704/ivanka-trump |title=Ivanka Trump's Plan For Total World Domination |first=Lisa |last=DePaulo |website=[[GQ]] |date=April 2007 |accessdate=February 19, 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091222135216/http://www.gq.com/women/photos/200704/ivanka-trump |archivedate=December 22, 2009 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.onwallstreet.com/news/2b-advisor-leaves-ubs |title=$2B Advisor Leaves UBS |date=September 15, 2015 |publisher=OnWallStreet |first=Andrew |last=Welsch |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160822080924/http://www.onwallstreet.com/news/2b-advisor-leaves-ubs |archivedate=August 22, 2016 }} From 2001 to 2005, she dated James "Bingo" Gubelmann. In 2005, she started dating real estate developer [[Jared Kushner]], whom she met through mutual friends.{{cite web |url=http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2016/08/22/ivanka-trump-and-jared-kushners-power-play |title=Ivanka and Jared's Power Play |website=[[The New Yorker]] |first=Lizzie |last=Widdicombe |date=August 22, 2016 |accessdate=September 30, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161007144756/http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2016/08/22/ivanka-trump-and-jared-kushners-power-play |archivedate=October 7, 2016 }}{{cite web |last1=Sherman |first1=Gabriel |title=Ivanka Trump on New Fiancé Jared Kushner: 'He'll Be a Great Father' |url=http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2009/07/ivanka_trump_on_new_fiance_jar.html |accessdate=June 1, 2017 |website=New York Magazine |date=July 17, 2009 |language=en |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161202061920/http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2009/07/ivanka_trump_on_new_fiance_jar.html |archivedate=December 2, 2016 }} The couple broke up in 2008 due to the objections of Kushner's parents, but they got back together and married in a [[Chuppah|Jewish ceremony]] on October 25, 2009.{{cite web |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20315305,00.html |title=Ivanka Trump Marries Jared Kushner in Lavish Ceremony |date=October 25, 2009 |author=Staff |website=People |accessdate=February 21, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110221211530/http://www.people.com/people/article/0%2C%2C20315305%2C00.html |archivedate=February 21, 2011 }} They have three children, a daughter and two sons, born in 2011 and later.{{cite web |title=Ivanka Trump Gives Birth to Theodore James Kushner |publisher=NBC News |date=March 28, 2016 |url=http://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/celebrity/donald-s-daughter-ivanka-trump-gives-birth-theodore-james-kushner-n546401 |accessdate=March 6, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160328083113/http://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/celebrity/donald-s-daughter-ivanka-trump-gives-birth-theodore-james-kushner-n546401 |archivedate=March 28, 2016 }} In an interview on ''[[The Dr. Oz Show]]'', Trump revealed that she had suffered from [[postpartum depression]] after each of her pregnancies.{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/to-your-health/wp/2017/09/20/ivanka-trump-reveals-struggles-with-postpartum-depression-on-dr-oz/ |title=Ivanka Trump reveals struggles with postpartum depression on 'Dr. Oz' |publisher=The Washington Post |first=Rachel |last=Chason |date=September 20, 2017 |accessdate=September 27, 2017}} Trump has a close relationship with her father, who has publicly expressed his admiration for her on several occasions.{{cite web |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/ivanka-trump-brilliant-mom-businesswoman-pregnant-baby-donald-trump-2015-9 |title=Donald Trump's brilliant daughter Ivanka is a businesswoman and mom |website=Business Insider |first=Benjamin |last=Nigh |date=September 26, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160115064947/http://www.businessinsider.com/ivanka-trump-brilliant-mom-businesswoman-pregnant-baby-donald-trump-2015-9 |archivedate=January 15, 2016 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.startribune.com/all-about-ivanka-trump-s-daughter-muse-and-deal-maker/334638071/ |title=All about Ivanka: Trump's daughter, political muse and deal-maker — in stiletto heels |first=Nancy |last=Benac |date=October 20, 2015 |website=Star Tribune |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160127234523/http://www.startribune.com/all-about-ivanka-trump-s-daughter-muse-and-deal-maker/334638071/ |archivedate=January 27, 2016 }} Ivanka has likewise praised her father, complimenting his leadership skills and saying he empowers other people.{{cite web |url=http://www.eonline.com/news/706544/ivanka-trump-proud-of-dad-donald-trump-over-his-presidential-run-but-it-s-also-complicated-for-her |title=Ivanka Trump "Proud" of Dad Donald Trump Over His Presidential Run, But It's Also "Complicated" for Her |first=Corinne |last=Heller |date=October 14, 2015 |publisher=E! |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151218143247/http://www.eonline.com/news/706544/ivanka-trump-proud-of-dad-donald-trump-over-his-presidential-run-but-it-s-also-complicated-for-her |archivedate=December 18, 2015 }} ===Religion=== [[File:President Trump visit to Israel, May 2017 DSC 3545ODS (34789024376).jpg|thumb|Trump (far right) with her husband and her father at the [[Western Wall]] at [[Temple Mount]] in [[Jerusalem]] in May 2017]] Trump was raised as a [[Presbyterian]] Christian.{{cite web |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/10-stars-changed-religion-love-article-1.2428300 |title=Zooey Deschanel joins these other stars who changed their religion for love |last=Dostis |first=Melanie |website=Daily News |location=New York |date=November 9, 2015 |accessdate=September 17, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160917164047/http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/10-stars-changed-religion-love-article-1.2428300 |archivedate=September 17, 2016 }} She [[conversion to Judaism|converted]] to [[Orthodox Judaism]] in July 2009,{{cite web |url=http://www.jta.org/2016/11/06/news-opinion/united-states/ivanka-trump-visits-the-lubavitcher-rebbes-grave-ahead-of-election |title=Ivanka Trump visits the Lubavitcher rebbe's grave ahead of election |date=November 6, 2016 |publisher=Jewish Telegraphic Agency |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161109153519/http://www.jta.org/2016/11/06/news-opinion/united-states/ivanka-trump-visits-the-lubavitcher-rebbes-grave-ahead-of-election |archivedate=November 9, 2016 }}{{cite journal |last=Messer |first=Lesley |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20291939,00.html |title=Ivanka Trump Converts to Judaism for Fiancé |journal=People |date=July 17, 2009| access-date= February 19, 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100420062522/http://www.people.com/people/article/0%2C%2C20291939%2C00.html |archivedate=April 20, 2010 }} after studying with Elie Weinstock from the [[Modern Orthodox Judaism|Modern Orthodox]] [[Ramaz School]].{{cite web |last1=Oppenheim |first1=Maya |title=Ivanka Trump seems confused about the religion she converted to |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/ivanka-trump-emma-watson-rabbi-quote-hillel-a7238656.html |accessdate=May 29, 2017 |website=The Independent |date=September 12, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170217202947/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/ivanka-trump-emma-watson-rabbi-quote-hillel-a7238656.html |archivedate=February 17, 2017 }} Trump took the [[Hebrew]] name "[[Yael (name)|Yael]]".{{cite episode |title= |url= |series=The View| series-link = The View (U.S. TV series) |credits= |network=[[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]| air-date = October 26, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/ivanka-trump-opens-converting-orthodox-judaism/story?id=29244637 |title=Ivanka Trump Opens Up About Converting to Orthodox Judaism |date=February 26, 2015 |first=Lesley |last=Messer |website=[[Good Morning America]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150722101603/http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/ivanka-trump-opens-converting-orthodox-judaism/story?id=29244637 |archivedate=July 22, 2015 }} She describes her conversion as an "amazing and beautiful journey" which her father supported "from day one", adding that he has "tremendous respect" for the [[Jewish]] religion.{{Cite web |url=https://www.algemeiner.com/2016/10/28/ivanka-trump-at-florida-synagogue-my-father-called-before-jewish-high-holidays-and-said-you-better-pray-hard-for-me |title=Ivanka Trump at Florida Synagogue: My Father Called Before Jewish High Holidays and Said 'You Better Pray Hard for Me' |first=Barney |last=Breen-Portnoy |date=October 28, 2016 |website=Algemeiner Journal |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161029113958/http://www.algemeiner.com/2016/10/28/ivanka-trump-at-florida-synagogue-my-father-called-before-jewish-high-holidays-and-said-you-better-pray-hard-for-me/ |archivedate=October 29, 2016 }} She attests to keeping a [[kosher diet]] and observing the Jewish [[Shabbat|Sabbath]], saying in 2015: "We're pretty observant... It's been such a great life decision for me... I really find that with [[Judaism]], it creates an amazing blueprint for family connectivity. From Friday to Saturday we don't do anything but hang out with one another. We don't make phone calls."{{cite journal |last=Van Meter |first=Jonathan |date=February 25, 2015 |url=http://www.vogue.com/11739787/ivanka-trump-collection-the-apprentice-family/ |title=Ivanka Trump Knows What It Means to Be a Modern Millennial |journal=[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150506192313/http://www.vogue.com/11739787/ivanka-trump-collection-the-apprentice-family |archivedate=May 6, 2015 }} When living in New York City, Trump used to send her daughter to kindergarten at a Jewish school. She said: "It's such a blessing for me to have her come home every night and share with me the Hebrew that she's learned and sing songs for me around the holidays." Trump and her husband made a pilgrimage to the [[Ohel (Chabad-Lubavitch)|grave of the Lubavitcher Rebbe]], a popular prayer site, shortly before her father's election victory.Kaplan Sommer, Allison, [http://www.haaretz.com/world-news/u-s-election-2016/1.751279 "Ivanka Trump, Jared Kushner, visit Lubavitcher rebbe's grave to pray for election victory"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161111023715/http://www.haaretz.com/world-news/u-s-election-2016/1.751279 |date=November 11, 2016}}, ''[[Haaretz]]'', November 6, 2016. On May 22, 2017, Trump and Kushner also traveled with her father on the first official visit of [[Israel]] by the [[Trump administration]], where her father made the first visit to the [[Western Wall]] by a sitting U.S. president.{{cite web |last=Rafferty |first=Andrew |date=May 23, 2017 |title=Trump Becomes First Sitting U.S. President to Visit Western Wall |url=http://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/trumps-first-foreign-trip/trump-becomes-first-sitting-u-s-president-visit-western-wall-n762891 |website=[[NBC News]] |location=[[New York City]] |access-date=May 24, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170523205922/http://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/trumps-first-foreign-trip/trump-becomes-first-sitting-u-s-president-visit-western-wall-n762891 |archivedate=May 23, 2017 }}
{{cite web |last1=Baker |first1=Luke |last2=Holland |first2=Steve |date=May 23, 2017 |title=In U.S. presidential first, Trump prays at Jerusalem's Western Wall |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-israel-wall-idUSKBN18I1V6 |website=[[Reuters]] |location=[[London]], [[England]] |access-date=May 24, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170523233417/http://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-israel-wall-idUSKBN18I1V6 |archivedate=May 23, 2017 }}
{{cite web |last=Diamond |first=Jeremy |date=May 23, 2017 |title=Trump makes historic visit to Western Wall |url=http://www.cnn.com/2017/05/22/politics/trump-israel-western-wall/ |website=[[CNN]] |location=[[Atlanta, Georgia]] |access-date=May 24, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170523221254/http://www.cnn.com/2017/05/22/politics/trump-israel-western-wall/ |archivedate=May 23, 2017 }} Ivanka also visited the [[Yad Vashem]] [[The Holocaust|Holocaust memorial]] in western [[Jerusalem]] and the [[Church of the Holy Sepulchre]] in the [[Christian Quarter]] {{Refimprove|date=July 2015}}
'''Jean Van Milders''' (13 November 1924 – 20 June 2011<ref>[http://www.humo.be/humo-dossiers/32102/jean-van-milders-overleden. Artikel over zijn overlijden in [[Humo]]], 20 June 2011</ref>) was a Belgian businessman and the president of soccer team [[AA Gent]] for ten years.
==Business career== Born in [[Geel]], Van Milders was a talented entrepreneur. He managed to develop the Brewery Van Milders situated in Geel, which he had inherited together with his brothers from his parents, to a sound company and he introduced the abbey beer Tongerlo. 1970, The brothers sold their brewery and started bottling [[Coca-Cola]]. As from 1976, they were catering Carestel-road restaurants.
Van Milders sometimes proclaimed very strange expressions about his entrepreneurial management. A good one-liner of his was: "As a child, what did we know about money? Nothing at all! And now, I've got grandchildren playing with their money on the stock markets."
==President of AA Gent== As from July 1988 to 1998, Van Milders was he president of [[AA Gent]]. This soccer team was just degraded out of [[ Belgian First Division]] and the team had a heavy burden. Van Milders used his rich bank account to help the team financially.
In soccer, this meant a large difference at AA Gent. He transferred some well-known players to the team, making the way of playing more attractive. After a number of years, the team played European games again. In 1992, AA Gent reached the quarter finals of the [[UEFA Cup]]. This was the best European result under his guidance. In the Belgian competition, it did not work out so well the next years, but the foundations of the successes were laid. Those were achieved under his successor [[Ivan De Witte]].
Van Milders died in [[Knokke-Heist]].
==References== {{Reflist}} *{{cite web|url=http://www.kaagent.be|title=KAA Gent|publisher=kaagent.be|accessdate=2015-07-25}}

<!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Jo Bury 071230.jpg|thumb|200px|right|Jo Bury]] --> '''Jo Bury''' was till 2012, Managing Director of [[Vlaams Instituut voor Biotechnologie|VIB]] (the [[Vlaams Instituut voor Biotechnologie|Flanders Institute for Biotechnology]]) and previously held the post of Managing Director of VLAB (Flanders Action Programme in Biotechnology).
Jo Bury obtained a Master's degree in Pharmacy and a PhD of Pharmaceutical Sciences at the [[University of Ghent]]. He obtained an MBA degree at the [[Vlerick Leuven Gent Management School|Vlerick School for Management]] in [[Ghent]]. After performing scientific research in the field of [[atherosclerosis]]<ref>Rosseneu M, De Backer G, Caster H, Hulstaert F, Bury J, Distribution and composition of HDL subclasses in students whose parents suffered prematurely from a myocardial infarction in comparison with controls,Atherosclerosis. 1987 Feb;63(2-3):231-4</ref> during several years, he continued his career in science policy.
==See also== * [[Rudy Dekeyser]]
